data.title: Balancing Near-Term Headwinds and Long-Term Growth: Justifying a Buy/High-Risk Rating on Pharma Direct-Led Upside
data.description:
Citi analyst Daniel Grosslight maintained a Buy rating on GoodRx Holdings yesterday and set a price target of $4.50.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Daniel Grosslight has given his Buy rating due to a combination of factors, balancing a weak near‑term outlook against more attractive long‑term drivers. He notes that while 4Q results were operationally solid, with revenue and adjusted EBITDA exceeding expectations on the back of strong Pharma Direct momentum, guidance for 2026 is muted as management intentionally resets prescription transactions pricing and absorbs margin pressure from business mix shifts.

At the same time, he emphasizes that Pharma Direct is growing rapidly and is expected to expand about 30% year over year in 2026, while subscriptions, including the weight‑loss offering, are returning to growth and should become more meaningful by year‑end. In his view, the current share price already discounts much of the PTR headwind and margin compression, leaving substantial upside as the transition plays out and higher‑growth segments scale, which supports his Buy / High Risk recommendation and sizeable expected return potential.

In another report released yesterday, TD Cowen also assigned a Buy rating to the stock with a $3.00 price target.

GDRX’s price has also changed dramatically for the past six months – from $4.330 to $1.990, which is a -54.04% drop .
data.author: TipRanks Auto-Generated Intelligence Newsdesk

data.title: Sunrun: Strong Cash Generation, Storage Growth, and Balance Sheet Strength Support Buy Rating Despite Cost and Guidance Headwinds
data.description:
TD Cowen analyst Jeff Osborne maintained a Buy rating on Sunrun today and set a price target of $23.00.

Claim 50% Off TipRanks Premium

  • Unlock hedge fund-level data and powerful investing tools for smarter, sharper decisions
  • Stay ahead of the market with the latest news and analysis and maximize your portfolio's potential

Jeff Osborne has given his Buy rating due to a combination of factors, including Sunrun’s strong fourth‑quarter cash generation and improving profitability driven by a higher mix of asset sales into new financing structures. He also highlights record storage attachment rates, expanding grid services, and new joint ventures that enhance financial flexibility and support the company’s multi‑year cash generation targets.

At the same time, Osborne acknowledges headwinds such as softer value‑creation metrics, higher installation costs tied to larger solar‑plus‑storage systems, and 2026 guidance that trails consensus expectations. Nonetheless, he views Sunrun’s shift toward higher‑margin direct sales, its growing base of dispatchable storage assets, and a strengthened balance sheet with limited near‑term debt maturities as outweighing these negatives, underpinning his positive stance on the stock.

In another report released today, Clear Street also maintained a Buy rating on the stock with a $24.00 price target.
data.author: TipRanks Auto-Generated Intelligence Newsdesk
